revised_title: Skeletal Variations in Fungid Corals: A Study of Pavona Varians and Psammocora Haimiana from Tahiti
tldr: This article examines the skeletal growth and variations in two large coralla from Tahiti, Pavona varians and Psammocora haimiana. The author identifies four distinct facies in the specimens, including Pavona varians, Pavona cactus, Merulina ampliata, and Hydnophoroid, which showcase the wide range of morphological variations in these coral species.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Coral Reef Ecology
